title: Venezuelan chocolate chicken
description: This traditional South American chicken dish incorporates chocolate to give it a unique and authentic flavour. Served with crispy fried corn cachapas
author: Paul Young

dishes.name: chocolate chicken
steps: Preheat oven to 200 °C. Heat [#1|2 tbsp|oil] on a heavy-bottomed frying pan over a medium-high heat. Add the [#2|2 clove(s)|minced|garlic] and [#3|2|finely chopped|shalots] and fry until tender.

Brown the [#4|500 g|chicken] on each side, for about 10 minutes, then add [#5|3|juiced and zested|orange juice and zest], [#6|3|chopped and seeded|fresh] and [#7|2|shreded and seeded|dried chillies], [#8|1 tbsp|coriander seeds] [#9|400 g|tomatoes] and [#10|1 tbsp|sugar]. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, then cook in the oven for a further 20 minutes.

Remove the pan from the oven and set the chicken aside. Add the [#11|85 g|chopped into pieces|chocolate pieces] to the pan and stir until blended, at which point you will have a dark, gravy-like sauce. Return the chicken to the pan, ready for serving with the cachapas and [#12|4 sprig(s)|roughly chopped|coriander].

dishes.name: cachapas
steps: In a food processor, puree the [#13|400 g|corn] with [#14|0.25 cup|milk], [#10|2 tbsp|sugar], [#15|0.5 tsp|salt], [#16|0.25 tsp|pepper], [#17|1|egg] and [#18|0.75 cup|cornmeal]. The mix should be the consistency of a thick pancake batter.
Heat a large non-stick frying panover a low heat and add some [#19|4 tbsp|butter]. When it is melted and is hot, add the batter, forming 10 cm circles. Cook for 2 minutes on each side.
